column1: CA/303/2006 and C.A.L.A. 321/2006 decided on 11/07/2012 the Court

column2: “It is trite law that even if the accused does not specifically take up the
defence of a general or special exception to criminal liability, if the facts

column1: and  circumstances  before  the  court  disclose

column2: materials to sustain such a plea then the court must consider whether
the accused should be convicted for a lesser offence”.
